content: Thirty-two observational and randomized studies reported the success rates for conversion to sinus rhythm for an antiarrhythmic drug and/or electric cardioversion (Supplemental Table S4). The overall success rate for conversion to sinus rhythm using amiodarone was 91% (95% CI, 82-97; 25 studies, N= 1035) when the longest duration of follow-up available was used (Fig.3). The success rates according to follow-up duration were 54% after 12 hours (95% CI, 48-61; 5 studies; N= 263), 71% after 24 hours (95% CI, 55-86; 10 studies; N= 542), 83% after 48 hours (95% CI, 71-92; 5 studies; N= 449), 96% after 72 hours (95% CI, 73-100; 3 studies; N= 287), and 96% at discharge (95% CI, 90-99; 6 studies; N= 376)
